Wed., May 9: Join us to honor the tenacious advocates who keep us free.
  


Lights of Liberty Awards Dinner

Wednesday, May 9, 6 p.m.
The Manor
111 Prospect Ave.
West Orange, NJ 07052

I'm excited to share the lineup for this year's Lights of Liberty awards dinner.

Join us on Wednesday, May 9 at The Manor in West Orange starting with cocktails at 6 p.m. followed by the program at 7 p.m.

The evening's keynote speaker and honorees show us every day that not all heroes wear capes:

  • Susan Herman, president of the ACLU board of trustees, a law professor mobilizing the million-plus members of the ACLU's resistance.

  • Jason Camilo, an attorney representing Abdul, a man who was detained and nearly deported by immigration agents despite his visa for helping the U.S. armed forces in Afghanistan.

  • Make the Road New Jersey, a grassroots organization that builds power among immigrant and working class communities.

  • Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler, PBWT, the law firm that successfully challenged discriminatory zoning against mosques in Bernards Township and Bayonne.

They're tenacious, brilliant advocates standing up every day to make New Jersey and America truly free. We can't wait to honor Jason, Make the Road, and Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler for their incredible work, and we can't wait to hear dispatches from the national ACLU's Susan Herman.

RSVP today! We hope to see you on May 9 at The Manor!
